title: 108_s1582
content: The Act may be cited as the "Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004" and includes amendments to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 includes amendments to Section 104(e) regarding the acquisition of outstanding mineral interests by the Secretary. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 allows the Secretary to acquire outstanding mineral interests with available funds. If negotiations fail within 60 days, the Secretary can acquire the interests through section 3114 of title 40, United States Code. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act allows the Secretary to acquire mineral interests with available funds. Any difference in compensation amounts will be paid from a permanent judgment appropriation. The Trust will determine the necessity for expenditures. The Trust, applicable to Government corporations, determines obligations and expenditures character, necessity, and manner of incurrence, allowance, and payment. The Trust members and designated employees may solicit donations. The Trust members and designated employees may solicit donations. Section 106(h)(1) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to include proceeds from activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999. SEC. 3. BOARD OF TRUSTEES. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act amends the roles and compensation of trustees, allowing for compensation of the chair at a rate determined by the Board of Trustees. The chair of the Board of Trustees may be compensated at a rate determined by the Board, not exceeding the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule. The total compensation for the chair in a fiscal year should not exceed 25 percent of the annual rate of pay for level IV. The chair of the Board of Trustees may be compensated at a rate not exceeding 25 percent of the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule under section 5315 of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. Property Disposal Limitations amended under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act to include restrictions on disposal duration and termination. Amendment to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act includes new provisions regarding property disposal limitations and law enforcement and fire management. Amendment to the Valles Caldera Preservation Act includes new provisions for law enforcement and fire management, specifying roles for the Secretary and the Trust. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act amendment includes provisions for fire management, requiring the Secretary to develop a plan for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve in consultation with the Trust. The plan must align with the management program previously established. The Secretary must develop a fire management plan in consultation with the Trust, aligning with the established management program. Services will be provided through a cooperative agreement. The Secretary may provide presuppression and nonemergency rehabilitation and restoration services for the Trust on a reimbursable basis. The Senate passed the document on September 15, 2004, with Emily J. Reynolds as the Secretary.
